results.title: Etoiles 2: Ici Paris
results.creator_credit: Luis Espana, BBC-TV and Sensible Films
results.brief_description: This second instalment of the ‘Etoiles’ series uses a pacy magazine style to take the viewer around Paris and its most original and quirky aspects. Far from concentrating on the usual monuments and landmarks, this series attach itself to the lifestyles of 12-14 year old people living in Paris, the variety of their experiences and ethnic background. The programme is intended to be used by second year French students and above. It contains 5 episodes on 13 minutes each (approx.) Includes guide with transcripts of each episode and additional activities.

results.title: Ethiopia advances
results.brief_description: An account of the work of the Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations in helping Ethiopia make best use of her fertile land. FAO experts’ recommendations included the use of labour saving farm implements; importation of new seeds to improve local crop; the setting up of an experimental seed growing station; the vaccination of Zebu cattle against Rinderpest.

results.title: Ethics in the computer age
results.brief_description: Examines the loss of revenue suffered by the designers and producers of computer software caused by the pirating of video games. The focus is on the theft of “intellectual property” by people using computers in their homes. It also explains the dangers of hackers accessing sensitive information and the potentially life-endangering results of tampering with that information.

results.title: Eternity
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Johnston, Susan MacKinnon and Vivid Pictures
results.brief_description: For forty years in one city a word appears written on the street. It could have been any word in any city of the world, but this word was ‘Eternity’. Always the same, written in chalk in elegant copperplate script, appearing like frost overnight on the streets of Sydney. In 1956 the writer was discovered after twenty years of secrecy. He would continue to write this word until his death in 1967. Director Lawrence Johnston’s internationally award-winning documentary is an orchestration of beautiful black and white cinematography combined with haunting music. Biographical reconstruction succeeds in including the audience amongst those whose lives have been touched by Arthur Stace’s lonely and mysterious mission.

results.title: Eternal children
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Children who through heredity, brain injury or various other causes are not equipped to keep pace in a competitive world - are they to be society’s unwitting castaways? This film gives a frank appraisal of the problem and shows methods of care and training being developed in special schools and institutions for the mentally disabled. (Awards: Columbus; New York)

results.title: Eternal change: story of a mountain
results.brief_description: Traces the origin of Mount Rainier from eruption through a rift in the surface and its development in subsequent volcanic action. Shows the cycle of the seasons, the erosion by wind and water, the action of snow and ice and the movement of the glaciers.

results.title: Esty Deez
results.creator_credit: Tom McPartland, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A frank look at the importance of using condoms to prevent sexually transmited diseases. Discusses the dangers of having multiple sexual partners and what should be done if an STD is contracted. Depicts the behaviour of adolescents together with contemporary language to ensure the attention of the intended audience. NB: TEACHER PREVIEW PRIOR TO CLASSROOM VIEWING IS RECOMMENDED.

results.title: Estate of change
results.brief_description: Ascot Vale housing estate was in a state of decay with poorly maintained buildings, not support services and poor and dangerous living conditions. The tenants formed a tenants group which initiated change, maintenance, improvements in living conditions, provided services such as legal aid, migrant classes, a theatre group, milkbar and a community centre. This video shows the change process through interviews with tenants. The second half of the video is the theatre piece performed by the community theatre group.

results.title: Establishing new plants
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Discusses how sexual reproduction, plant propagation and factors affecting plant growth are vital in establishing new plants for commercial production. Dormancy, the means by which a seed may survive in conditions where a plant may not, and different methods of seed scarification used to commence germination are also examined. Highlights methods of propagation including obtaining cuttings, grafting, budding and the use of rootstock.

results.title: Essential interview skills: teachers guide (MS)
results.brief_description: This teacher’s guide is designed to accompany the short video, ‘Essential interview skills’, produced to help young people who are preparing for work and/or tertiary entrance. It addresses many common questions such as “What are prospective employers looking for?” and features discussions with employers and universities. The video can be used in a variety of classroom situations such as VET, SOSE, Industry, Enterprise and Technology design studies, home groups, study skills seminar or work experience preparation seminars.
